descr: "A set of healthcare-related information that is assembled together into a single logical document that provides a single coherent statement of meaning, establishes its own context and that has clinical attestation with regard to who is making the statement. While a Composition defines the structure, it does not actually contain the content: rather the full content of a document is contained in a Bundle, of which the Composition is the first resource contained."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Composition resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Logical identifier for the composition, assigned when created. This identifier stays constant as the composition is changed over time."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "The workflow/clinical status of this composition. The status is a marker for the clinical standing of the document."

fields.name: type
fields.descr: "Specifies the particular kind of composition (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note). This usually equates to the purpose of making the composition."

fields.name: FHIRclass
fields.descr: "A categorization for the type of the composition - helps for indexing and searching. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the Composition Type."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "Who or what the composition is about. The composition can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (e.g. a machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of livestock, or a set of patients that share a common exposure)."

fields.name: encounter
fields.descr: "Describes the clinical encounter or type of care this documentation is associated with."

fields.name: date
fields.descr: "The composition editing time, when the composition was last logically changed by the author."

fields.name: author
fields.descr: "Identifies who is responsible for the information in the composition, not necessarily who typed it in."

fields.name: title
fields.descr: "Official human-readable label for the composition."

fields.name: confidentiality
fields.descr: "The code specifying the level of confidentiality of the Composition."

fields.name: attester
fields.descr: "A participant who has attested to the accuracy of the composition/document."

fields.name: custodian
fields.descr: "Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the composition/document information."

fields.name: relatesTo
fields.descr: "Relationships that this composition has with other compositions or documents that already exist."

fields.name: event
fields.descr: "The clinical service, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented."

fields.name: section
fields.descr: "The root of the sections that make up the composition."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: meta
fields.descr:
"The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource
